New Records: The Suns’ 7-1 start matches the best in franchise history, equaling three previous seasons (1980-81, 2000-01, 2009-10).
Key Match Events: Kevin Durant scored 32 points, Jusuf Nurkic had 20 points and 18 rebounds.
The Suns rallied from a 15-point deficit to defeat the Miami Heat 115-112.
Durant’s jumper from the free-throw line with 16 seconds to play gave Phoenix a four-point lead.
Devin Booker had 22 points and nine assists.
Booker made one of two free throws with 4.8 seconds to go, giving the Heat a chance, but Miami failed to get a shot off before time expired.
Bradley Beal’s 3-pointer put the Suns ahead to stay at 106-103 with 3:52 to play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns committed 16 turnovers that led to 20 Miami points.
Adebayo was just 5 of 21 from the field, and three of his baskets were dunks.
